acmg_steps.details: LRRK2 variants are linked to Parkinsonism via dopaminergic neuron loss, locomotion deficits, lifespan reduction, and mitochondrial dysfunction.
Transgenic Drosophila models overexpressing LRRK2 variants reflect the disease mechanism (neurodegeneration, mitochondrial toxicity).
Wild-type control is present, but no explicit mention of replicates or variant controls in the abstract.
Drosophila models are standard in neurodegenerative disease research, and the assay aligns with known pathogenic mechanisms.
No explicit mention of pathogenic/benign variant controls in the abstract.
No OddsPath calculation or statistical tests reported for this variant.
Assumed ≤10 control variants due to lack of explicit data, but assay validity is supported by standard models.

final_evidence_strength.description: Functional evidence is supportive of pathogenicity, though limited by insufficient replicates and control variant counts.
